input: Anne is not green. Anne is nice. Anne is white. Bob is kind. Gary is nice. Harry is blue. Harry is kind. All kind, white people are red. All kind people are nice. All blue, round people are white. All nice people are white. All green, white people are round. All nice, red people are green. Question: Harry is not round.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : ¬ Green Anne
axiom T2 : Nice Anne
axiom T3 : White Anne
axiom T4 : Kind Bob
axiom T5 : Nice Gary
axiom T6 : Blue Harry
axiom T7 : Kind Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ White x → Red x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Nice x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x ∧ Round x → White x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → White x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ White x → Round x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Red x → Green x

theorem harry_is_not_round : ¬ Round Harry :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Harry is round

theorem harry_is_round : Round Harry :=
begin
  apply R5,
  split,
  apply R6,
  split,
  apply R2,
  exact T7,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R4,
  apply R2,
  exact T7,
  apply R4,
  apply R2,
  exact T7,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
